abstract: Tea Party group FreedomWorks says its survey seeking public input on reducing federal deficit found broad support for repealing Pres Obama's health care legislation and eliminating entire federal departments, but much less enthusiasm for changes to Medicare and Social Security.
snippet: In an attempt to “crowd-source” a plan to reduce the federal budget deficit, FreedomWorks, a libertarian group, says it found broad support for repealing “Obamacare.”

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: In an attempt to “crowd-source” a plan to reduce the federal budget deficit, FreedomWorks, a libertarian group, says it found broad support for repealing “Obamacare.”

headline.main: A Tea Party Panel Supports Health Care Law’s Repeal
headline.print_headline: A Tea Party Panel Supports Health Care Law’s Repeal
headline.seo: FreedomWorks Deficit Survey Backs Repeal of ‘Obamacare’
